header.name: AD9912
header.description: 1 GSPS(up to 400 MHz analog output), 14-bit DDS

fixed.name: Instruction
fixed.description: Set write mode I15=0, I14:I13=00(1 byte) and  I12:I0 reg address.

fixed.name: Update Mirrored regs
fixed.description: Software access to the register update pin function. Writing a 1 to this bit is identical to performing an I/O update.

fixed.name: Instruction
fixed.description: Set write mode I15=0, I14:I13=00(1 byte) and  I12:I0 reg address.

bits.name: PD HSTL driver
bits.description:
Powers down HSTL output driver.
1 = HSTL driver powered down.

bits.name: Enable CMOS driver
bits.description:
Powers up CMOS output driver.
1 = CMOS driver on.

bits.name: Enable output doubler
bits.description: Powers up output clock generator doubler. Output doubler must still be enabled in Register 0x0200.

bits.name: PD SYSCLK PLL
bits.description:
System clock multiplier power-down.
1 = system clock multiplier powered down.
If the S4 pin is tied high at power-up or reset, this bit is set,
and the default value for Register 0x0010 is D0, not C0.

bits.name: Full PD
bits.description:
Setting this bit is identical to activating the PD pin and puts all blocks
(except serial port) into power-down mode. SYSCLK is turned off.

bits.name: Digital PD
bits.description:
Removes clock from most of digital section; leave serial port usable.
In contrast to full PD, setting this bit does not debias inputs, allowing for quick wake-up.

fixed.name: Instruction
fixed.description: Set write mode I15=0, I14:I13=01(2 bytes) and  I12:I0 reg address.

bits.name: PD fund DDS
bits.description:
Setting this bit powers down the DDS fundamental output but not the spurs.
It is used during tuning of the SpurKiller circuit.

bits.name: S-div/2 reset
bits.description: Asynchronous reset for S prescaler.

bits.name: S-divider reset
bits.description: Synchronous (to S-divider prescaler output) reset for integer divider.

bits.name: DDS reset
bits.description: Reset of the direct digital synthesis block. Reset of this block is very seldom needed.

fixed.name: Instruction
fixed.description: Set write mode I15=0, I14:I13=00(1 byte) and  I12:I0 reg address.

integers.name: N-divider
integers.description:
These bits set the feedback divider for system clock PLL.
There is a fixed divide-by-2 preceding this block, as well as an offset of 2 added to this value.
Therefore, setting this register to 00000 translates to an overall feedback divider ratio of 4.

fixed.name: Instruction
fixed.description: Set write mode I15=0, I14:I13=00(1 byte) and  I12:I0 reg address.

bits.name: VCO auto range
bits.description: Automatic VCO range selection. Enabling this bit allows Bit 2 of this register to be set automatically.

bits.name: 2× reference
bits.description:
Enables a frequency doubler prior to the SYSCLK PLL
and can be useful in reducing jitter induced by the SYSCLK PLL.

bits.name: VCO range
bits.description:
Selects low range or high range VCO.
0 = low range (700 MHz to 810 MHz).
1 = high range (900 MHz to 1000 MHz). For system clock settings between 810 MHz and 900 MHz,
use the VCO auto range (Bit 7) to set the correct VCO range automatically.

fixed.name: Instruction
fixed.description: Set write mode I15=0, I14:I13=10(3 bytes) and  I12:I0 reg address.

integers.name: S-divider
integers.description:
CMOS output divider. Divide ratio = 1 − 65,536. If the desired S-divider setting is greater than 65,536,
or if the signal on FDBK_IN is greater than 400 MHz, then Bit 0 in Register 0x0106 must be set.
Note that the actual S-divider is the value in this register plus 1.

bits.name: Falling edge triggered
bits.description: Setting this bit inverts the reference clock before S-divider.

bits.name: S-divider/2
bits.description:
Setting this bit enables an additional /2 prescaler.
See the CMOS Output Divider (S-Divider) section.
If the desired S-divider setting is greater than 65,536,
or if the signal on FDBK_IN is greater than 400 MHz, this bit must be set.

fixed.name: Instruction
fixed.description: Set write mode I15=0, I14:I13=11(stream) and  I12:I0 reg address.

integers.name: Frequency Tuning Word
integers.description:
These registers contain the FTW (frequency tuning word) for the DDS.
The FTW determines the ratio of the AD9912 output frequency to its DAC system clock.

fixed.name: Instruction
fixed.description: Set write mode I15=0, I14:I13=01(2 bytes) and  I12:I0 reg address.

integers.name: DDS phase word
integers.description:
Allows the user to vary the phase of the DDS output.
See the Direct Digital Synthesizer section.

fixed.name: Instruction
fixed.description: Set write mode I15=0, I14:I13=00(1 byte) and  I12:I0 reg address.

bits.name: OPOL
bits.description: Output polarity. Setting this bit inverts the HSTL driver output polarity.

fixed.name: Instruction
fixed.description: Set write mode I15=0, I14:I13=00(1 byte) and  I12:I0 reg address.

bits.name: CMOS mux
bits.description:
This bit allows the user to select whether the CMOS driver output is divided by the S-divider.
0 = S-divider input sent to CMOS driver.
1 = S-divider output sent to CMOS driver.

fixed.name: Instruction
fixed.description: Set write mode I15=0, I14:I13=01(2 bytes) and  I12:I0 reg address.

integers.name: DDS phase word
integers.description:
Allows the user to vary the phase of the DDS output.
See the Direct Digital Synthesizer section.

fixed.name: Instruction
fixed.description: Set write mode I15=0, I14:I13=11(stream) and  I12:I0 reg address.

integers.name: Spur A harmonic
integers.description:
Spur A Harmonic 1 to Spur A Harmonic 15.
Allows user to choose which harmonic to eliminate.

integers.name: Spur A magnitude
integers.description: Linear multiplier for Spur A magnitude.

integers.name: Spur A phase
integers.description: Linear offset for Spur A phase.

bits.name: HSR-A enable
bits.description: Harmonic Spur Reduction A enable.

bits.name: Amplitude gain × 2
bits.description: Setting this bit doubles the gain of the cancelling circuit and also doubles the minimum step size.

fixed.name: Instruction
fixed.description: Set write mode I15=0, I14:I13=11(stream) and  I12:I0 reg address.

integers.name: Spur B harmonic
integers.description:
Spur B Harmonic 1 to Spur B Harmonic 15.
Allows user to choose which harmonic to eliminate.

integers.name: Spur B magnitude
integers.description: Linear multiplier for Spur B magnitude.

integers.name: Spur B phase
integers.description: Linear offset for Spur B phase.

bits.name: HSR-B enable
bits.description: Harmonic Spur Reduction B enable.

bits.name: Amplitude gain × 2
bits.description: Setting this bit doubles the gain of the cancelling circuit and also doubles the minimum step size.
